author: UMA GUPTA
title: Loom Solar to strengthen its presence in Southern India
contents:
Solar tech start-up Loom Solar introduced an array of solar solutions for residential, commercial, industrial, agricultural and other applications at RE Expo in Bengaluru recently.
Loom Solar showcased its solar panels from the basic capacity of 10 W to 575 -700 W bifacial TOPCon panels built with 16 bus bars, energy storage solutions from 75 Wh to IoT based Atlanta 5 kWh-45 kWh, 3 kW – 100 kW high-frequency solar inverters, and customisable small solar panels for government and DIY projects that prioritize design aesthetics.
“We have launched an array of solar solutions that are future ready and well aligned to address the growing power needs of our customers in south India,” said Nishi Chandra, head-marketing, Loom Solar.
To support the solar adoption, Loom Solar has chosen three core frameworks: Facilitation of faster solar loan and/or solar subsidy, innovation at product and solutions level, and distribution/access and touch-points.
